alert.note: Alert for Bedford (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:21AM CST until February 17 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace affecting Bedford County. For the Other Area Rivers...including Wartrace, Vernon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate Winette Ayers Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 10.5 feet and beginning to fall. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 800 AM CST.
